ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The senior essay in French can be painful if not time-managed well, but if you space out the work, choose topic and get all research materials well in advance, it will be enjoyable. Make sure you pick a topic you love! There's nothing worse than being married to a topic you don't enjoy writing about. Choose an adviser who you are comfortable with; having had them before as a professor helps. Do not leave the writing of the essay to the last minute! It will take longer than you think, especially if you haven't ever written a paper of this length before (if you are not doing the intensive major the French senior essay may be either in French or English and is about 30 pages). I stayed over Spring Break to work on mine; though I missed being with my senior friends on vacation, the last few weeks of second semester were so much more relaxing and open for me since I'd completed a draft. If you're not a very well-disciplined worker (I wasn't), it might be helpful to draw up a set of goals for every weekly meeting with your adviser. This will help keep you honest in staying on track to eventually write the thing. In the end, it's just a really long essay!
